definition: everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: For once his even temper was disturbed.
sentences.chinese: 这一次，他那四平八稳的气质遭到了破坏。

sentences.english: Sit firm and steady like a large bell, not swaying or moving.
sentences.chinese: 好像大钟一样，四平八稳，不动不摇。

sentences.english: One who does menial work; a drudge.
sentences.chinese: 她做起事来几乎都是四平八稳。

sentences.english: The furniture of lacking in initiative and overcautious looks this year, already " earth must drop broken bits " .
sentences.chinese: 四平八稳的家具在今年看来，已经“土得掉渣”。

sentences.english: She does almost everything on an even keel.
sentences.chinese: 她做起事来几乎都是四平八稳的。

sentences.english: Armrest and suspension column should lacking in initiative and overcautious .
sentences.chinese: 扶手和柱脚应四平八稳。

sentences.english: Chairs should remain squarely on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 椅子要保持四脚着地，四平八稳。

definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
conforming with the norms of society
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
